title: Gustav Klimt
subtitle: Vienna July 14, 1862 - Vienna February 6, 1918
content: Klimt is one of the founders of Vienna Secession, the Union of Austrian Artists (on 3 April 1897). Painters, graphic artists, sculptors and architects, united for less traditional art and more freedom of expression. Klimt ranged between eroticism, landscapes and portraits, around 1814 he was criticized  for decorating the Great Hall of the University of Vienna with three audacious paintings. The three pieces were destroied when Schloss Immendorf was burned in May 1945.

title: Golden Phase
subtitle: Golden Phase
content: In its Golden Phase, Klimt heavily used golden leafs, it can bee seen in the Portrait of Adele Bloch-Bauer I (1907), The Kiss (1907â€“08) and The Three Ages of Woman (1905)

title: Three of life
content: The only landscape during Gustav Klimt golden period

title: Adele Bloch-Bauer I
content: Klimt pieces have been sold as some of the highest prices recorded for individual works of art, Adele Bloch-Bauer I $135 million, Adele Bloch-Bauer II $150 million
